description: Via Latin, from Ancient Greek πολύπτωτον (polúptōton), neuter of πολύπτωτος (polúptōtos, “having many cases”), from πολύς (polús, “many”) + πίπτω (píptō, “I fall”).

nouns.description: polyptoton (countable and uncountable, plural polyptota or polyptotons)

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) A stylistic scheme in which words from the same root are used together, or a word is repeated in a different inflection or case.
